title: Meet One Of Ferguson's New City Councilors
teaser: In the wake of national protests over the shooting death of Michael Brown, we talk with Wesley Bell, one of the city's new leaders.
contentencoded:
Last August, the St. Louis suburb of Ferguson became a nationally known city after a white police officer, Darren Wilson, shot an 18-year-old black man, Michael Brown.

In the wake of nationwide protests, city officials encouraged Ferguson voters to exercise their right to vote so they could see the change they were fighting for.

Here & Now’s Robin Young speaks with newly-elected council member Wesley Bell about next steps for the city.

Guest

  • Wesley Bell, newly-elected member of the Ferguson City Council.
